item.title: we are on our own, COVID-wise
item.description: A new academic year has begun, and this year it seems that we’re on our own, when it comes to protecting ourselves against COVID-19. In the latest guidance from the CDC and UW-Madison, we’re told that “individual responsibility” is sufficient to combat infectious disease. From the UW-Madison FAQ about COVID: Is it okay to ask someone I work with if they have been vaccinated? No. A person’s vaccination status is private, just like any other medical issue or condition, and employees should not be asked to share this information.
